review: I used to love TGIFridays, but after my trip there for my last birthday, they won't be getting any more patronage from me. After seeing all their great specials on the TV i decided that would be a fun place for a birthday dinner. NOPE. The wait time was changed several times, the host was apologetic, thats fine, he can't control that. Our server was like a carbon copy of Seth from Superbad. and he was a super bad server. No personality, no idea how to interact with human beings. The portions were minuscule compared to the price. Skip TGIFridays and try Applebee's instead.

Good place for happy hour. Service is dependent on what day you go. Friday/Saturday service is average (approx 10-15 minutes for your drink to arrive, 20 or more for your food). I have been going here for years and will continue to go.
They have the best happy hour! Great service provided by Josh the bartender:) and great food!

I understand that thisis a college community and you think that all we look forward to comsuming is alcohol but sometimes college students need to eat. I will never ever choose to eat at tgif  again the quality of the meal is no longer what it use to be the portions no longer justify the price. You can completely tell that the manager is cutting corners as quality of food is definitely not what they were serving I got the sizzling chicken and shrimp and the chicken came out like jerky its no longer a breast of chicken but thinly sliced over cooked chicken served with shrimp cover with spaghetti sauce. And boxed mashed potatoes.  There are tons of choices here and tgif will never ever ever be on my list again

I've only been here during the night time when all the rowdy college kids come out. Weekend dinner to late night can be pretty busy so make sure you come early and get a table. It can be a hefty wait time. If you come during late night, don't expect it to be quiet and relaxing. A lot of groups, including my own, can get really loud.  Staff is okay. They get the job done.  Food is so-so. You can't expect much from these chain restaurants but if you have a great crowd, the food won't be such a big deal. However, they have a great happy hour! If you're a lightweight, (like myself) it won't cost you more than $10 to get a good buzz. Along with the drink deals, all appetizers are half off.

Every time I come here (unless I'm with a birthday dinner party or something) I sit at the bar, and I've always gotten great service. The bartenders are super friendly and they remember you! It's a pretty typical place to get a drink and some appetizers, but I give it 3 stars, because I've got nothing to complain about!
A good place to go some grub on with friends and family. All time favorite is the Jack Daniel Ribs and shrimp!  And of course drinks are good too.
Service eh. Food eh. Love happy hour !!!! Ordered the cheese dip which was good. Chicken wings were normal. Sliders were ok as well. Dessert was great!!! Love the Oreo madness.

Do not have a TGI Friday's in my hometown so when I see a branch, I'll stop by once in awhile.  Saw this branch in Fresno so decided to drop by for a quick snack. Came in sometime between 2 and 3 pm on a week day.  Was seated quickly and served quickly also.  Since I was not really hungry, I just ordered my all-time favorite food from TGIFs. I ordered the Loaded Potato Skins appetizer!  TGIF is where I first discovered this treat, and nobody does it better than TGIF.  Something about those potatoes loaded with melted cheese, bacon bits, sour cream, and green onions just tastes so very very good.  They just do not taste the same buying them from the frozen food section at the grocery store. I'm not too crazy about anything else on the menu.  The potato skins are enough to make me a fan though.

Bad service!! We went in and before we even ordered drinks we are asked if we wanted full dinner menus.. When they brought our drinks back they didn't ask what we wanted to get for dinner.. They came back a few minutes later (and keep in mind they asked if we wanted dinner menus) they said, "oh...,, we stoped serving dinner two minutes ago and completely wasted my time, my girlfriends time and more importantly her brothers time who happened to be the birthday boy & he didn't get to eat dinner that night on his own birthday...... Way to go TGI Fridays.... Never going back... EVER!

Great place for happy hour, service is decent.  The place is very accommodating to big groups and they sing happy birthday.  I haven't been wow'd by their food but I like coming back with friends for half off appetizers and drink specials.

Have to agree with the person who said "service eh, food eh".  We got there about 2:30 today....not a busy time of day.  It took forever to get our food, and then the waiter did not bring what I had ordered.  So here my friends were eating and I sat waiting for the right food.  I wasn't impressed with the food either.  My recommendation--don't waste your time or your money.

I was excited about coming here as I hadn't been in over a year since there isn't one in my hometown. My boyfriend and I got here a little after midnight on a Friday night and we were seated immediately. The first thing a I didn't like was that they had my chair on an uneven level of ground and the chair was wobbling. I nearly fell when I sat down... Very unsafe. Strike one. We had to wait 20 minutes for the people behind us to leave so we could push our table and my chair back. Next thing, they bring out my bf's Sprite and there's a brown object (small rock?) in the cup. Ew. Strike two. The waitress gladly brought out another drink. It took a really long time for our food to come out like 45+ mins... No apology about the wait! Strike three! I ordered the Jack Daniels chicken with a baked potato. The waitress never asked if I wanted fixings on my potato! Ugh so when they bring it out it is literally a DRY potato with nothing on it but green onions. I had to ask the chef (whoever brought out our food; wasnt the waitress) to bring my fixings- bacon, cheese, butter, sour cream.... He brings everything except the bacon and I never got it. Baked potato issue strike four.  I dig into my chicken and it is unusually tough to cut but I take a bite anyway and quickly regretted it & had to spit it out. The chicken was rubbery and tough! Ugh strike five!! My bf ordered the same thing so I taste his chicken and it is moist and cooked correctly. Mine wasn't. I tell the waitress and she offers to have the kitchen redo it but we were in a rush to leave so she just takes the charge off our bill. I feel like they should have done more than that though... One mistake? Fine. Two? Okay its a busy night. But FIVE issues is excessive and unacceptable. Pretty pissed about this horrible experience. Only giving two stars because my bf's food was cooked right.

I received terrible service from the very start I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone everyone was all over the place and nothing was organized! I am defiantly not satisfied the food was also very cold when it was brought out to my table
Happy hours are the best. Their chicken shrimp cajun pasta is just delicious...the food can be inconsistent but when they get it right, it's great!

It was a little sad, since the last time I have been here the cleanliness has gone down, what used to be cut kitsch, is now cluttered and old. The food was ok, the staff was very friendly, just feeling like they need to deep clean and update.
Sara, I would say is my favorite waitress she's very friendly and she makes you feel very welcomed. I would definitely go back there because of her kindness and warm smile.

Horrible horrible!!! Waited over 15 minutes to he acknowledged by a server. Restaurant was not packed. Ordered the new appetizer promotion which was all you can eat. After waiting 45 minutes, people around us that arrived after us and also put in orders after us all got their food, including appetizers. Waitress came back with plates. No food. We had to grab the bus boy to ask them to get our check for our drinks. Waitress came with food. Who wants to wait 45 minutes in between each all you can eat order. We canceled. They made sure to charge us for our drinks and waitress said it was her fault she waited to put our order in. That may have worked had she ever stopped by the table to apologize before we told her we werw leaving. This place used to be great. What a sad place it has become.

service is great! food is very mediocre just like all the other locations in the chain. Came here with several coworkers for lunch. Order one of the $10 bottomless appetizer deals they are currently having, boneless wings and they were decent. I got a lunch size salad and had the dressing on the side since most of the time salads are drenched in dressing. The food tasted mediocre but consistent with the other locations. Our waitress was awesome! She came by often to check on us, refilled all our drinks without us ever asking, anticipating our wishes. Really liked her.  Parking is easy, and there's a great dessert place next door.
Had a large group for a special occasion and our server Robert did a very nice job taking care of my party

I had better, not a unique experience but good deals on appetizers. I wish I had a better review for this place since I heard so many great stories and promotion but this place was mediocre and service wasn't that great. I ordered two unlimited appetizers for $20.00. In reality I just wanted to try out their famous potato skins and chicken wings. After I took those bites I knew I was in love, they're actually pretty good considering how simplistic is to make.  The drink I ordered (I forgot the name) was really good and full of bursting flavor, even had a freaking pineapple leaf as a garnish. I haven't tried there entree meals but I will go again to do so on a timely manner. Rate this place 3.0

It's the all American food norm and restaurants. Spinach dips, hamburgers, and etc etc., they have Manson jars now for some of their mix drink specials, but can barely taste the alcohol. Our server was GREAT!
Every time we dine here we receive such excellent service.  We even see the manager help out the servers. Love their happy hour! Our server, Nicole helped us tonight and she was so great!

I came in one night to have some drinks and appetizers. It was about 11pm and the place seemed really unorganized. The hostess was rude. Didnt greet us. Didnt say anything for a few minutes and then said "oh... Did you want to sit? Table... Or.. Bar... Or..."  The bar was packed with overly drunk people who probably should all have been cut off. Whos monitoring their alcohol licence here? One girl was screaming for a guy to stop touching her (ummm where was the manager or bouncer or someone!?!). We asked for a table to avoid that mess and ended up waiting forever for a simple drink order. 45min for two beers and a diet coke? Seriously? The only good thing was our waitress. She was sweet and keep apologizing for the bar patrons and the wait. Needless to say, she was tipped well. I would not go back. Im actually looking into how to report what I saw to someone in charge of that. Its just wrong that a big company like this can get away with that and local businesses are being checked and monitored daily. Someone should be fired for what I saw.

Went here tonight to celebrate my best friends birthday. I was not really excited about going here but it was her birthday. The 1st & last time I went here was like 10 years ago. Wasn't impressed then & tonight proved my point. The beer was cold but food sucked. Ordered the potato skins, and club sandwich w/ salty as$ fries. I can make better @ home. I didn't even wanna try my husbands French dip  looked gross!    The restrooms were old, beat up and disgusting! Clearly this store needs a makeover. In fact I'm praying we don't get sick tonight! I don't wanna think about the kitchen.  Our server James was super nice & great but I wouldn't recommend this place at all. Yosemite in Clovis is my favorite and now I really see why. Spend your hard earned $$$$ somewhere else.
Don't like this place!  The environment  is chill  But the potato skins were DISGUSTING! And cold  But the serve heather  was great and prompt  she got tipped well
Love the food and espiecially their happy hours!! Def a hot spot and love that it opens late :)

Went out for a appetizer only dinner with the lady. Was pleasantly surprised when our waiter told us happy hour is early during Monday night football. We ordered potato skins, mozzarella sticks, teriyaki chicken strips and muchos nachos. It was all real good except the nacho chips were soggy. Great night out for 1/2 price

We went to lunch yesterday.  The server was pleasant.  We arrived before the rest of our party. She kept the chips and salsa coming and refills on drinks.  We split a lunch, not a problem.  The food was hot and with good taste.  Love the free chips and salsa with Stripes Rewards.  I like to go when I am in Fresno.
Have not been here in a couple of years. TGI FRIDAY'S still has that get out have a great meal for a low price. Over all great meal. Great flavor..great drinks.. great price.

Went here to get some lunch with my girlfriend on a Saturday. The floors were dirty,  the bathrooms were filthy and the food was greasy and tasteless.  The chairs where filthy with years of dirt/grime.  Waitress was nice and only good part of experience.  They should get new owners/managers that know how to run a business because existing management obviously just doesn't get it.  I'll never return to this establishment.  Take your hard earned money elsewhere.

Out of towner here, I decided at the wish of my family to stop in to TGI Fridays. We ordered the bottom-less appetizers. Potato skins, ahi tuna chips, and spicy chicken tostadas. Let me say the food was awesome. The tuna chips were my favorite of all. The potato skins although a bit greasy were quite delectable.  I decided to make this review because the staff was so on the ball with the food. Literally we blinked our eyes and the food was refilled. It was all so filling and we were good enough to not get dinner at that point. Our server Erica was so awesome as well. So quick at refilling appetizers and drinks. The bill even disappeared and was closed out before we could finish the meal. If I am ever back in the area again, I will definitely stop in. Good job TGI Fridays. A+ service.
I always love going to TGIFridays!! Their happy hour is awesome, excellent service, and low wait times for food! Our servers, Robert and AJ, were awesome! Thanks for another great night! :)

The service was good and the steaks we ordered... jack daniel flat iron... was tasty. The sides i ordered parmesan steak fries and the mozzarella tomato salad was terrible. My hubby had double order of their normal fries... which was greasy and limp. The potato skins were greasy overly fluffy potatoes. Tasted overcooked and seemed to me they cut them down in size from years past... So extremely bad quality. .. not worth the price. So overall... 2 stars and that was for the steak itself.
I love TGI Friday's. But this location is small. I came here for dinner. I ordered the chicken strips with fries. It was great. I don't like it that this location is small.

Friday's is love, Friday's is life. Best happy hour in town. Pretty darn good appetizers half off and cheap margaritas. The wall decor has a bachelor pad feel to it. Shocking how well the bartenders tend a crowded bar. It seems like there is always a thousand people around the bar, but the tenders are always speedy and available. Very impressive.

Love the bar great drinks very rarely dissatisfied however the food will make you sick, wasn't busy on a Tuesday night, a decent crowd but nothing to cause our food to be so awful, I was sick,for several days and this wasn't the first time. Don't look at the picture's don't read the description you will not get anything close to what you think you are.

Haven't been here in years! Wanted to check it out. I have to say, that the service rocks! The server Andrew (AJ) was a delight. Very knowledgable with the menu. But, on the downfall, disappointed with the food. Pasta was blah. Chicken on both plates were dry. Rice seemed not fully cooked. I will eat just about anything, but if I graded just food, I would be giving 2 stars.     Very loud. Hard to hear the company. But, if your looking for a place to kick it with some friends and a beer at the bar, this is the place. They have a happy hour half off appetizers menu. That's a plus.

TGI's is the best place for ribs and the fries are super delicious I have gone to other restaurants for ribs or steak and they do not compare. The service is great I love the food I have been here a number of times and have tried just about everything on the menu and I am always satisfied except for the burger forgot which one but it tasted really salty other than that the ribs always come out perfect . I'm thinking of going this weekend for some bomb ribs.

Every time I come here I always had great customer service. I love the food but unfortunately I can't eat here all the time. I wish the bar was a little bit bigger just in case it gets packed I would like to eat and go. I really can't complain too much. I usual eat here for cheat day or to treat myself from a long work load. Cool place to just chill for me. I would give this a 5 if they can get me hooked.
Went in for lunch- worst service ever by a server Named Ashley. I will never go into that Friday's or any Friday's ever because of how awkward and rude she was to us.

The food is okay. I personally just get some drinks and appetizer. Good place to come with friends or co-workers to relax and have fun. The service is great, they really want you to enjoy yourself when you're there. Bottom Line. Get the pretzel appetizer!!! It is delicious!!
The food here is always great and I absolutely love the staff! I've never had a bad visit! Not to mention, OUTSTANDING HAPPY HOUR!!!!

alright food expensive 23$ for a steak dish but i got what I paid for right? nah got my plate, smaller than I expected side dishes were small, I wanted more rice shit everything was bland, not enough flavor yo expect mashed potatoes never again

Slow service, though i understand they were busy. Server was okay. Not too friendly. Food wasn't great. My dad enjoyed his sandwich. But the potato skins were disgusting. And my sandwich and fries weren't hot. They were warm/borderline cold when they came out.  Took over 10 minutes to get a kamikaze shot. Overall, pretty disappointed. Not coming back.

Let me start off by saying this place is a joke!!! The management obviously has their heads up there fucking ass's. Just about every employee is rude and every employee is un-happy. The hostess mecenna is a absolute bitch with her snooty stuck up additude. Bitch your a minuium wage employee at a dead end job! You have no room to be stuck up to anyone and deffenetly no need to be stuck up to paying customers! Your a pathetic excuse for a hostess. Anyways to the thing they call food here.. The food absolutly sucks!! Tried the new burger the other day "smoke stacked burger" with sausage and bacon and two pattys. Well what a absolute joke that burger was!!!! A piece of bacon broken in half with ONE!!!!! little peice of sausage the size of a penny!! Then I get a shit small portion for fries!! I asked my waitress what the deal was with my fries and she said they weigh the fries now and give you nothing for fucking 13 dollars!!! The waitress agreed with me and said she can't believe the little amount of portions you get... I have had the French dip before that was absolutly disgusting!! The Au Jus sauce was so salty it ruined the sandwich with the stuff they called meat. The Potato skins are disgusting!! The wait time here is a absolute joke!!!! 40 mins to get my hamburger the other day. My waitress was so unhappy that she said she is looking for a new job because of "exact words" of how fucked up the management is here! No communication with her managers that hide in the back all day long.. You can see some tall balled headed dorky fucker walking around with his thumb up his ass not doing shit. And while I was there he was pissing off a family at another table I was next too when he ignored them when they had a complaint!! They were so furious at him that I'm surprised not to see a complaint on here about it. Later I found out that was the manager through my waitress... You sir are a disgrace!!! How your a manager of this dump surprises me!! Ignoring paying customers is pathetic!! Making them pay for the garbage you call food is a outrage!! This place is a absolute joke!! I can't even discribe how unhappy I have been coming here. I have been here now 3 times in the past 2 months trying to give this place a shot and a second chance but this was the last time!!! I don't feel guilty at all writing this. This place needs new management badly not only for the buisness sake but for the staff's sake. Way to much stress for the employees for a minuium wage job!! 1 star is being way to generous....

Happy hours after 9 till closing on weekdays with 1/2 price appetizers and under $7 drinks, what's not to love about going to TGI Fridays for that. Also their bar service was excellent. Im not so sure about the main dishes here, but their appetizers is the bomb and delicious. I also do love the interior, very classical looking American bar and restaurant  with great wood work and also stained glasses at their ceiling lights. Parking here is really easy after 9, with pretty of FREE private parking lot.  For appetizers my sister and I ordered the 1/2 price after hours special for $5 loaded skin potatoes and ultimate nachos. The loaded skin potatoes was crispy on the skins and was nice and soft on the inside, had an amazing savory taste that brings party to my mouth, dipped in the sour cream, can someone say hallelujah;  there was probably 10 of them which is a lot for just $5. Also the nachos was just so big  and generous in serving, everything from the guacamole, to the sour cream and side salad tasted fresh, while the nachos was crisped and generously drizzled with melted cheese, jalapeños and grilled chicken. Whats a perfect balance of taste for appetizers.  The drinks was good but not the best, I still preferred the margaritas from chili's. I ordered the ultimate margarita $6 and my sister order the tropical sunset for $4, both drinks were perfectly made. I would have preferred my margarita to have a stronger lime juice taste, but can't complain because the triple-sec was a generous amount, which almost got me tipsy with just one drink. It was served in the 20oz glass. I would also had loved my margarita to be served in a margarita glass though, but that's ok , still had a good time.  Overall excellent happy hour with 1/2 of appetizers and great drink prices. Definitely would return for their happy hour and appetizers.

I went in the other day and I ordered a steak with mashed potatoes and veggies super delicious the steak was so flavorful and the mashed potatoes were super delicious and creamy and the veggies were also delicious the staff was super friendly but Sarah was the best super nice and friendly and fast hands down to Sarah for her kindness and her great work ethic defiantly recommend going to Tgi Btw the Brownies there are so delicious
Good service, food was decent, got the cajun shrimp chicken pasta. Drink was on point (peachy keen). I would come back again.

Amanda was our server she was very friendly and provided perfect service! She defiantly went above and beyond for us! Food was spot on good job Friday's! Also our drinks from the bar were honestly the best I've ever had!

I've been to many TGI Fridays and this location to me is perfect! The customer service was amazing! It's a smaller restaurant which is good. It feels like family! The food was delicious, well prepared the staff friendly and amazing. Portion sizes were perfect! If you're craving deliciousness, this is the place to go. I really loved the staff. Thanks for an amazing experience and i'd highly recommend paying TGI Fridays out!
Good food and fast service If you are a reward members u got free chip and salsa  also free food when u get to certain points and any other perks

No joke, I will never go back to this pit of disparity.  The food was served on a dirty plate, and our server was incredibly rude to my wife. James aka the original server went on break, and AJ took over for him. I will say AJ was very quick and filled up our drinks and managed to make our experience decent. I'm giving the 1 star to James. If you read this james, just know you should leave the industry and go back to square 0.

TGI Fridays has grown to recapture and become my favorite 'All-American' food cuisine restaurant.  I used to eat here very frequently in the past until I experienced a few poor consecutive dining experiences. After contacting their corporate headquarters and sending them a letter discussing my less than pleasant visits, I returned several months to a year later that I noticed a huge improvement in food quality and customer service.  Ever since then, my visits here have been top notch and I have never experienced any issues. The food comes out hot and on time, and the waiters are friendly. When I come here, I always ask for my favorite waiter, James, by name because he is always on  -point. The food here is amazing. The Jack Daniels sampler is a must have appetizer for meat-lovers. Make sure to order the strawberry lemonade which is delicious.

Went into Friday's today, at 4:15pm.  Went to the bar for a beer.  Sat down  and two women were there (I didn't say bartending). They were chatting away.  The manager signaled her to turn around, she waited until they ended their gossip.   I'm giving 2 stars as they were polite and smiley. But that's where service ended. All they did was continually chat to themselves, ignoring myself and the other couple at the bar. I understand why the bar is empty. If they had even asked how I was, they would have found out that I had worked for Fridays and at that store. But they were not interested. They were interested only in their own gossip. They didn't even introduce themselves,  but Ashley's name was on the receipt.  Friday's is nothing what it used to be.  Thank you for your time. Ps. The bar did get busier after I left, about 5:00PM.

We have always been welcomed and quickly seated. Our food was delicious (the rib eye & shrimp pasta) and our server, James, has been waiting on us for 7 years and has always been excellent and attentive. The last visit was on a very busy Friday and the manager, Sam, was also busy on the floor. The happy hour drinks are substantial & the bartender was excellent.

Overall this is another great location for Friday's. They also have one the nicest dog friendly outdoor dining areas around . Service here is always outstanding and attentive. The food is tasty in general but usually over salted however still generic and expected for a chain. Best to come here when you have a game day or Sunday's since it is happy hour all day.  Sign up for their rewards called "stripes", best part of it is every few months they send you a coupon for a free entree with a purchase of one  entree and 2 drinks , no maximum amount
Anytime you find crawling creatures in your food it's hard to give any place a good rating. Found a bug in my salad and the customer service was below average.

Food was decent. Waitress was good about keeping drinks refilled. Proportions were small but I guess that's not all bad if your trying to stay in shape. Tables were very small and seating was cramped. It's basically Applebee's with a little more class. Don't get excited because they didn't raise the bar much. Prices were high for the quality and quantity of food you received. Nothing to write home about. Would recommend if I didn't like the individual.

Walked in and thought "not too bad." That was my mindset until the waitress brought out my appetizer. I kid you not there were 6 mozzarella sticks. Enough to feed a newborn child. As I looked through the menu I saw prices that seemed as if you're buying furniture. I ended up settling for the baby back ribs. Let me tell you this they aren't kidding about the baby. I got more meat in my pinky toe than the meat that came on these ribs. Felt like I was eating squirrel ribs they were that small. Let's just say I walked out of here starving. I'd come back but I'd definitely try something different.

I ordered a steak medium rare and got a steak that was raw in the middle.  Not was it only raw it was semi frozen.   The idiots working the grill attempted to grill a frozen steak. Last time I go to any TGIFridays.

Went in to eat at around 9:40pm and was not given any type of help for over 25minutes. Very poor service, especially since there was little to no customers there at all to begin with at all and at least 3 different servers. It was pretty much one server to each table and I was still not helped. Wtf?
Slow slow slow. Sat at a table for 10mins and wasn't even greeted. Bar service was slow also. Not impressed. Now I know why we don't normally come here.

Friday's is a fantastic spot for terrific food and tasty drinks. I use to come here regularly with friends, and not too much has changed. My most recent visit was rather smooth. The place was packed, literally. It was a cold night, and even the patio was full. Our wait wait was about 30 minutes, and the host texted us when our table was ready. We ordered shrimp cocktail, loaded potate skins, buffallo wings, quesadillas, fries, and a crapload of drinks. The shrimp was excellent and fresh, and I loved the quesodillas, which were topped with pico de gallo. Everything tasted lovely. My long island ice tea was mixed well, and I could definitely taste the alcohol, which is a good thing. I'm happy to see remolded women's restroom, and the servers were quick and attentive. We had a positive visit.
Went with a party of 10 last night. Excellent service. Food was good. We were seated outside, they have heaters. I honestly have no complaints.

My food came out fast but the waitress never came back to check if I need any condiments. When she finally came back and check on me, I asked for A1 sauce. She left and never came back. 30 minutes later I asked another waitress for my A1 sauce and she finally went and grabbed it for me. I'm not satisfy with the service.

I've never been here before and now that I have I'm not too impressed. Our waiter seemed scatter brained and it took forever to get our drinks. Not a huge fan but maybe I'll try again maybe just a bad night

They changed the cheese on the potato skins to cheez whiz. I flagged our waiter down and asked her and she got a manager who told me it wasn't cheez whiz, but it was. No way that stuff wasn't from a can. She also told me if I wanted they could make them with "real cheese". Uh huh. My question: why wouldn't you ask patrons which kind of cheese they want when ordering? Anyway... as we were leaving, the ppl sitting behind us asked their waiter when they started using canned cheese on the potato skins. True story, I have witnesses lol.

This location is fabulous I order the wonderful chicken strips with a nice salad and I was very pleased with the customer service & the chicken strips were so fresh and the salad tasted wonderful. The price's are great and the Happy Hour is even better if you want to take friends out to eat & I love the fact that you can sit outside and enjoy the lovely weather. So I'll be back & I'm thankful for having a very tentative waitress that was so sweet & always checking on us even if we were on the patio. I really enjoyed myself & left with another place to bring my friends & family :0)

Giving 5 stars just for our server, Robert. I wish we had gotten his last name, because he deserves a raise (he was serving the high tops in the bar area around 7-8pm on Monday 4/25/16). The service here is usually very good, but Robert just went above and beyond. His friendliness wasn't forced or fake. He just seemed happy to be there and we all enjoyed our time a little extra because of him.
Service was excellent. We were seated quickly even though it was Mother's Day. We both had the steak and lobster tail and it was wonderful. Love eating at TGI Fridays.

Great  place to hangout  with friends  and happy hour is great  for all. Nichole  the bartender is awesome  and friendly,  Ashely  the bartender  is awesome  as well  and remember  my name. I go once a month.

I'm literally depressed. I'm in town visiting and eating here for the first time. It is officially my favorite restaurant after just one visit the food is amazing the service is awesome and the environment is nice. I'm depressed because there is literally not one fridays where I live and it hurts my heart keep up the good work guys I'll be back next time I'm in town for the lobster.
Best happy hour and apps in town! Cool spot to hang out and catch a good game in the bar area, totally recommend this spot

Long story short me and 2 friends came to get unlimited appetizers we waited 45 minutes to get one appetizer and our waitress never checked on us our drinks were never refilled. Service was just horrible and I will not be back.

Appetizers and cocktails were good, but the rest of the meal was just average. The ribs were dry and not flavorful. The sides were not great... We would come back but only for the appetizers and cocktails!

For a chain restaurant....this place isn't so bad!  My boyfriend and I went in during the closing  happy hour and we went in on the menu. We each ordered a drink and enough appetizers to fill up our table. Appetizers were half off so you best believe we did our part to enjoy that deal. The appetizers were great. But what I really loved the most were the pretzel bread sticks. Oh my goodness they're like a hybrid of olive garden's breadsticks plus the pretzel place's soft pretzel. Literally heaven in my mouth when melted cheesy bacon dip is added on the side. Seriously, don't leave this place without ordering it.  5 appetizers and 2 drinks came out to around $30! TGI Fridays is a place worth coming back for happy hour deals.
Food was delicious and service was good! I like the menu change. It's not the TGIF of the past. Great red zone specials.

Solid 4 baby!! Kinda busy but still had good service and food was great, the happy hour is killer good and the updated look is awesome! Now all I gotta do is come here during some NFL games and I'll be a happy camper! I've been coming here for bout 20 years and this new look is long over due :) try a red beer not to bad at all

Can't beat happy hour all day Sunday with endless appetizers Came with family My server was awesome, explained that we couldn't order 1 endless appetizer between 2  Either 2 endless appetizers or 1 appetizer & a main I think that's fair, as they are here to make money and not give food away However our server let us order 1 endless appetizers as the kids ordered a meal each & the wife ordered a normal appetizers  Confusing ? Probably  All in all nice food, good friendly service  Will be back for sure

Easy lunch spot!  Ordered BBQ wings and Caesar salad.  Food was brought out quickly within 10 min.  Wings were tasty with the ranch and blue cheese.  Amber, the server was fantastic.  Friendly, upbeat and totally 100% excellent service!  Convenient parking.

Just went here for my free Veterans meal (with my family) & got denied by the waitress because it was "after 2:00". It was 2:05 & we had actually got there before 2 but by the time they sat us, someone wiped down our dirty table outside & the waitress came out  it was just a little after. Thanks TGIF, this Veteran definitely won't be going back!!
Very delicious and had very fast service! I recommend you try the Jack Daniels burger.
Very fast and friendly service. Water was refilled without asking and food came out fast. Came on a Wednesday night before xmas. Nice place to take friends and family from outside town.

I was compelled to leave this review after such stellar service the other night. Our server David was on top of everything, which was so great! He brought refill drinks or asked us if we wanted another drink at just the right times. He anticipated what we needed before we needed it. You rarely find that in this category of restaurants. Food was good, but would go back just because it was a great experience to be there.

Came here on a Sunday afternoon to have lunch and a couple of beers service was very slow mind u we sat at the bar where it was not busy the first bartender left and the relief bartender didn't pay attention to the other side of the bar! Finally he came over and took the drink order the gentlemen at the other side of the bar were making comments about staff and service being off! Food was mediocre at best no real flavor!! Will not be going over there any time soon

Pretty chill, my co-worker and I decided to come here 1/15/2017 after a good 1.5 hour of releasing endorphins. So you KNOW I didn't disagree. I DID have my pbj sandwich after my workout but I was still hungry. Upon arriving and checking in we had to still and wait while our table was being cleared off and mind you the waitarea is by the entrance doors. Burrrr! It was bloody freezing that night. So imagine just finishing going hard at the gym for leg day, sitting down waiting in agony when's dinner?! And other patrons entering. Gusts of wind hitting your body and you tense up to realize don't tense up your legs are hurting. Yea well terrible! Ahaha anyhow enough ranting about leg day We were seated in a timely manner, given menus and beverages with lemon. Our waitress came a minute later and asked if we were ready, me being hesitant and wasn't sure if I was SUPER hungry or just I can have a bit just started to order because I felt pressured since I know Tiffany hates when I say Uhm can I get another few minutes for at least 3/4 rounds. The PRESSURE was on lol I myself ordered  --nachos: 5/5amazing as usual. Needs more pico de gallo and jalapeños that I should've asked for --2 sliders: 4/5 first time having these bad babies and I could only finish off one! They're very fulfilling btw --basket of fries: 2/5 a little heavy on the salt but they were crisp and tasty --potstickers: 0/5 COLD. Felt as if it was a wrong order and we happened to get them before the time expire date. Tiffany doesn't complain but I do and she said "NO, I'm funna eat these Danni STOP!" Lol so lose-win. She ordered wings and a Cesar side salad. My eyes were a lot hungrier than my stomach, I can tell you that much. Enough food to take home and have another complete meal lol.  Total for the both of us $23.XX lol not bad
Amazing! I go here a few times a year and I'm never disappointed! Their jack Daniels sauce is the very best! Not so great picture, but I'll get a better one next time

This evening we went to Friday's. Our party consisted of 3 adults and 2 toddlers. After being told it would be 45 minutes to be seated we asked to sit on the patio. It was a cold winter night and we asked for the heater that was placed in the front entrance to be moved to the patio. The hostess told us no. After we finished out meal and were waiting for our check, 4 waiters moved the heater (that we were told couldn't be moved)  for a party of 4 young adults. Apparently it was ok for a 2 year old and 4 year old to sit in the cold but not these people. Just wrong.

My boyfriend and I came here on a Friday night as a splurge. We got seated right away and our waitress was friendly in the beginning. They had this special going on where certain appetizers were unlimited. We got the mozzarella sticks which tasted great but the waitress never asked us if we wanted more. We received our food and our waitress barely stopped at our table to check on our refills or if we needed anything else. She was so busy attending other tables but didn't stop by ours. I understand it's busy but I saw her stopped by the table near us several times when she didn't stopped at our table not even one time once we received our food. This was not a pleasant experience.

The tall, white female bartender with short colored hair is rude as can be. My friend and I approached two empty bar stools and with an obvious attitude, she stated that someone was still sitting in one of the seats. Which was fine, but she didn't stop there. She followed up with a, "There's a full glass of beer there, so yeah. Don't know what you're thinking." Okay, you little. Sure enough, a couple minutes later, the guy returned, grabbed his beer, and left elsewhere. Now what? Thankfully, she wasn't our bartender for the night. Nicole and the bald guy with glasses (I'm sorry, I don't remember your name!) were AMAZING. They were sweet and attentive, cracking jokes with us throughout our stay. Not once did we feel like they were too busy for us. Love them both!

They have a carbonated beverage with redbull in it and it is so yummy! My favorite drink! The Sizzling chicken and shrimp is delicious! Love the appetizers!! Mozzarella cheeses sticks are great!! Buffalo wings are so good! Yum! The service was good! The atmosphere is busy, loud, crowded, and packed!! You won't enjoy it if you are looking for a quiet romantic dinner! It's a fun little spot to stop by and try!

Our waitress was very helpful with ordering. She recommended we put in our first 3 rounds of the unlimited appetizers so there wouldn't be a longer wait on getting the orders in and out of the kitchen. Worked out great.

Saturday night, the place was packed. We were told a 25 minutes wait for 6 people however we were seated before 25 minutes. The restaurant was sort of congested so thank God we were seated near the patio; it helps with the door opening and closing as the waitress went out to the patio. Waitress wasn't too friendly, the breaker waitress was a lot more friendly and helpful. The food was good, drinks were great. Will probably go back not anything soon.
I have never had good service here... Not to mention they "mix", the drinks with a milkshake mixer, which they don't clean off after making the drink. ..... That was gross.

First and last time here. How does a restaurant run out of buffalo sauce. Wanted to try the wings but they were out. Ordered the fall off the bones rib and those were so dry and burned from the bottom. Not happy. The server didn't bother to ask us for refills. Bad service

We always hear this place is good so we figured we try it. Ordered crusted parmesan chicken, chicken was dry and had a strange kinda tarter sauce on it. Tomato mozzarella salad was not fresh. BF ordered the turkey burger. The patty was still frozen in the middle.  Won't be back.
Can't bring your stroller in so don't bring your kids . Oh and this happened on Mother's Day . F this place .

Tonight was just a horrible night! My friend and i came here after a graduation at 11pm the restraunt store close at 1am so we figure we had enough time to eat. We had a group of 10 people order the unlimited appetizer. 30mim later our waiter tells us we only have 30 min left before the kitchen close it took 40 min for them to bring out our food. Mind u she had already put our order in charge us for the unlimited appetizer.  9/10 recieved our first order everyonw had scarf down there food and was trying to ordee more but the waiter couldnt keep up. Or nexf order was all messed up they kept bringing us potatoe skins even though we didnt ask we couldnt order anymore more food all of us was still hungry. TOP IT OFF WE FOUND HAIR IN OUR FOOD! THEY ALSO GAVE ME BUFFALO CHICKEN WITH THE BUFFALO SAUCE ON SIDE AND RANCH ON SIDE BUFFOLA SAUCE NOT EVEN POURED OUR MIX ON THE CHICKEN. Other waiter had to help pick up her dishes refill our drink help her out cuz she couldnt keep up. Manager comes out tells me he cant do anything about he sorry. I can bring it to corp thats all he can do and say to fix the problem. The server was even being rude couldnt handle our checks right manager and server said it was our fault for coming in late. SERVE SPECIFICALLY SAID ," YOU GUYS RUSHED IN HERE IF I KNEW IT WAS GONNA BE THIS COMPLICATED I WOULDNT HAVE SERVED YOU GUYS!" Whats crazy the manager let her be rude and when i ask if he saw how she was acting and talking he said yeah i do see amd just kept saying im sorry i cant do anything about it. My friend was still gonna tip her and she had the audacity to say oh dont tip me and rudely walked away.  MESSED UP 10 PEOPLE NIGHT AND MY FRIEND GRADUATION NIGHT! WORST NIGHT AND PLACE AND MANAGEMENT!

First time at Friday's!! We had $100 gift card so we decided to dine there on a Saturday Night. I did not like the location of it but enough parking space. We got there by 8 pm-was told there was a 40-45 min wait; we were the only group there of 9 ppl. Upon observing the restaurant it is a fairly small space and the layout is an L Shape since the entrance is at a corner. Bar area is decent I like the bar stools enough Flat screens around the bar area. Bartenders were friendly and nice! Since we had a lot of ppl I'm going to rate only the dishes I had and tried only.  Appetizers: Boneless buffalo wings, quesadilla, potstickers, flatbread, queso chip dip and a trio platter. BBW: 4/5 I like the buffalo sauce and they did not over do the sauce-it was great!!  Quesadilla: 4/5 I believe it was Chicken--I really liked it! Great taste!  Potstickers: 5/5 my favorite!!! I'm a potsticker fan so I'm very judgmental but I would have to say I really liked these potstickers and the dipping  sauce!!! One thing is that these potstickers are maybe large sized so it would probably take two or three bites to finish one.  Entrees: Lobster and Steak; Full rack of ribs Lobster and Steak: 4.5/5 I really enjoyed my entree!! My sides were Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes! Like I mention earlier I'm a really picky person when it comes to certain food items. I fell in love with their mashed potatoes (5/5)!! As for their Mac and Cheese it didn't really taste like Mac and Cheese---Penne Pasta was used so I felt that it tasted like a pasta dish I feel that if they had make this particular dish into an entree it would really sell good because it tasted really good 4/5!! I had the option of grilling or steaming my lobster I choose grill it wasn't that bad. I had a 6oz steak medium rare! Ohh my--the cook did a great job bc it was perfect; the seasoning too!  Full Ribs Entree: 2.5/5 per my fiancé he did not like the BBQ sauce they put on the ribs. He is also a coleslaw lover and the did not like theirs.  Overall great first time experience!!! I wouldn't mind eating at a Fridays again. I loved our server she was great, friendly and hustle for our group! I asked all around and they all said they rate it 4 stars.

Horrible service.... came in my on a week day ordered food and drinks, it took 15mins to get food. I ordered a Long Island ice tea that was extremely watered down. Was not able to get my waitress attention for 5 minutes. Spoke with manager Nicole and explained my dissatisfaction with the service, responded with she would take care of it and I don't have to get "crazy." I never raised my voice or used vulgar language. I don't know why at a management level she would feel it's okay to respond to customer in that manner. I sent all the food and the watered down drink back to the bar and kitchen. I will not be attending this location anymore!

The hostess Clarissa needs some help with the way she speaks to the customers & notice how her negative body language is while greeting people. I was irritated when we were seated BUT Linda our waitress was AMAZING! So for that I have to give 4 stars! Linda returned to the table several different times. She made sure our drinks were full, she continued to return to the table to make sure we were happy with our food & if we needed anything! Top notch service at Friday's this afternoon! She deserves a raise if she works like this everyday! She is the reason many return to Friday's!
The food is really not that great here, better if you go elsewhere. If you have a large party of people, service will be slower than slow.

I came here with my sister and niece on 8/6/17 after they picked me up from my week long vacation. We decided on TGIFs due to it being our spot since we were in our early 20s. We got there around 7pm and the parking lot did not appear to be crowded but when we entered the place was packed! We requested to sit outside since there was one table of people outside and it was quite noisy. The host informed us that the only reason they came seat us outside is due to someone requested special service to have their dog outside with them. I still didn't see why we couldn't be seated outside so we are seated in a booth and the host ask us if we wanted a booster for my niece. We declined since she is big enough to eat at the table now without any accommodations. However the host kept asking us and we just said yes since he wants my niece to have a booster seat so bad. So we get the booster and she barely fits because she really didn't need it. We order our drinks and a beverage for the niece and we did not have our food ready due to catching up with one another. So we finally settled on the appetizer of nachos and they were delicious. A family friend decided to join us as well and we waited until he arrived. By then a large elderly group sat next to us and thought my niece was a doll! They made her shy due to all the wonderful interactions they were giving her! One of them even ticked my niece! Gotta love strangers! Anyways while waiting me order another appetizer which is the BBQ chicken flat bread and mind you each appetizer takes forever! The service of hosts is great but the food service is slow and could improve! Anyways our finally friend arrives and we order two more appetizers since they are half off on Sundays all day! My phone died at that time so I didn't get to photograph the food like I wanted but we also ordered cheese burger sliders and chicken quesadillas and man I was so stuffed by then! I will definitely be back and I hope the speediness of food improves!

This is the 1st complaint i have ever had here. Yesterday, ordered the 10 oz, Rib Eye and my daughter got the 6 oz, sirloin. Both tasted delicious. However, we both got very nauseated overnight and eventually took a toll on us. Maybe it was a weird coincident with the meats! I will continue going but will be Leary about getting the same again.
I've been going to this classic Fresno restaurant since it first opened in 1979. And for that four-decade period, there has not been a better place for food, family, friends & fun.
A good place to chill and grub.  We always get the endless apps. Good vibes. Good cheerful servers, waiters/waitresses.  Overall, awesome place to dine in.

I love TGI Fridays. The food and service are usually great EXCEPT for this past time I went. Our waitress Amanda was rude and had no hospitality. She was incredibly impatient and didn't treat us like valued customers. Hopefully our next visit is much more enjoyable

I love this place and the service but last night it wasn't it. Our waiter wasn't very attentive. He hardly spoke to us and acted as if he didn't want to help us and whispered when he talked to us i even had to say excuse me what you say. He never came to our table to ask if we wanted a refill on our drinks nor did he ask if we were enjoying our meal or was there anything else we needed. We ordered the lobster steak dinner and endless appetizers. The food was great! Just the service was not ok. Also when i asked for a to go box to take the remaining food home i was told no! and i explained that we been here a million times before and ordered endless appetizers and was always given a  to go box to take the left overs. He said that was wrong and wasnt suppose to happen. And once again refused to give us a to go box and told us we could take the left over broccoli home instead of the other food we wanted too take. Needless to say i still took my left over food home instead of letting it go to waste.

Well, nothing has changed. TGI Friday's has remained true to its menus since the moment they opened, and as always... the service was fantastic! Sadly, that is also a problem because there isn't a great deal of variety. However, it does seem as though their food was a little more greasy than normal this last time we were there. I had the Parmesan crusted chicken, and I noticed that there was a slight pool of oil at the bottom of my plate, but this might be because of the cheese. I'll admit the flavor is still there and has not changed, which left me with a satisfied feeling, but the overall "vibe" left me a with a slightly off feeling. I want to try it out one more time, because maybe they were having an off day... but overall, my experience wasn't as stellar as I had hoped!

Brittany was the kindest bartender I've ever encountered. She provided the greatest customer service and made some really great drinks! She really went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. Thank you so much Brittany for making our night! Awesome mozzarella sticks too Friday's!

WORST EXPERIENCE!!!! HORRIBLE!!!  Took almost an hour and being transferred 6 times, just to get someone to take my order. I ordered  4 rib specials at 12.99 each,  they tell me the bill was 106.00! I said that is not possible, it should be around 52 plus tax. She tells me that is the correct price. SERIOUSLY! That is basic math! The order total was over double that. They transfer me to another girl, who says maybe it's that much because of drinks. I DIDN'T ORDER DRINKS! It was a to go order, no drinks. I finally speak to the manager. He redoes the total, it comes out around 52 something. Okay, now to get the food. It's been an hour of frustration, but I'm assured the manager is personally making sure my order is right. I pay the bill, get all the way home and half the sides are missing!!! WTH!!! Call AGAIN,  manager says he will take off one meal because of all the problems.  At this point that meal should have been free, but ok I just want this mess over with. So now he charges my card AGAIN and says the more expensive charge will come off in 3 to 5 business days! SERIOUSLY!!! I WILL NEVER EVER EAT AT TGIF AGAIN, I WILL TELL EVERYONE I KNOW WHAT A HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE THIS WAS!

My service was The Best love this place Carolynn was the best she's awesome.. She was really friendly and helped us with our appetizer rewards and explain about the point Very helpful.... so if you go to TGIF on Herndon look for her..

I love the happy hours here. The people are so awesome. :) The food is good and the drinks as well .  Sucky Sundays, when everything is close on Sundays, here is a place to be. :) Add me fokes/message me. Lets have dinner together. :)

Let me begin by saying I try very hard to not patronize chain restaurants.  I feel it is really important to support local businesses.  However, on occasion, I end up at a "chain" due to location, or because of my friend's choice.  Anyway... today I was in a work training and had exactly one hour for lunch.  We were one block from Friday's, so we thought it was a good choice.  We called first to see if we could place our order so it would be ready when we arrived.  They said no, but not to worry... the lunch service is very quick.  Ok, sounds good. When we arrived we were happy to see that the restaurant was EMPTY.  This gave us hope that we would have plenty of time to enjoy our lunch and be back to our training in plenty of time. We were sadly mistaken.  I'm pretty sure that there was only one waitress working.  She was very nice, but we had to literally flag her down to take our order and then again to bring our check.  It was over 40 minutes to receive a "lackluster" salad and a turkey sandwich.  I think we figured out why the restaurant was a ghost town.  Never again.

It was late for lunch and early for dinner when I stopped in on a Monday. 4PM is a good time for a bargain at TGI Fridays.  I got an appetizer for half price (happy hour) and a steak and lobster dinner for $14.99. All that plus undivided attention as it was super slow at the time! The potato skins were just as good as I remembered them from long ago. (Oh, and that yummy sour cream you get with them? It's a mixture of sour cream AND ranch!). The lobster was small, but it was tasty and took care of the craving. My steak was flavorful and cooked to a perfect medium rare. You also get two sides with your dinner. They have a good baked potato, but I didn't care for the coleslaw which I chose in place of the broccoli. (Green stuff? Yuck!).  Anyway, if you get away from work early one day, try the specials here. And if you drink alcohol , it IS happy hour then!
Foods and the cocktails are really good and tasty! Also the service is ok.. it is nice to visit sometimes at night
Cool vibe, good food, & great service! 5 stars from me!!  My honey & I come to eat after we go shopping & usually get happy hour! Really good mini sliders & wings!!!
